author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Chief Judicial Magistrate Court on Friday sentenced three persons to three months’ imprisonment, holding them guilty of producing forged certificates to get admissions through the Centralised Admission Committee nearly a decade ago.

In 2005, CB-CID began investigation into alleged fraud in the admissions of professional courses through CENTAC. It unearthed six cases of producing forged documents.

In the case, 12 persons comprising 6 students and their parents were cited as accused by CB-CID.

They were charged under Section 471(Using as genuine a forged document or electronic) of Indian Penal Code and cases were tried before the Chief Judicial Magistrate Court here.

The Chief Judicial Magistrate Padmanaban held three of the accused, A.Dhandapani, M.Sankaran and P.C. Baskarane who were parents, guilty while acquitted their wards.

The CJM convicted and sentenced them to three months imprisonment besides imposing a fine of Rs.1,000 each on them.
title: Three sentenced in forged certificates case
